newsitem.title: USA: Kimberly-Clark to sell mill for $600 mln in cash.
newsitem.headline: Kimberly-Clark to sell mill for $600 mln in cash.

text.p: Kimberly-Clark Corp said on Monday it had signed a letter of intent to sell a pulp and newsprint mill to Alliance Forest Products of Montreal for about $600 million in cash.
The company said it would also include in the sale the mill's inventories and woodlands at Coosa Pines, Alabama.
It said it had also agreed to buy a "significant portion" of the pulp produced by the mill for its consumer products during the next five years.
The company, which expects a gain from the sale, did not reveal any further details about the transaction, which is to close in the first quarter of 1997.
Kimberly-Clark said it would use the money from the sale to fund its out-going program of share repurchases.
